title: You eat thousands of bits of plastic every year - National Geographic
body: A plastic pollution treaty, called Paris Plus, would come with a mandate—and more muscle than the climate accord. How a dramatic win in plastic waste case may curb ocean pollution.
readable_content: -User (2023-12-08): The article discusses the widespread presence of microplastics and the potential impact on human health. It highlights a study estimating that humans may be consuming thousands of microplastic particles yearly, mainly through food and water. The health impacts of ingesting microplastics are still unclear, but researchers suggest there may be cause for concern. The article also explores the various sources of microplastic ingestion and provides insights into the types of plastics commonly found in the environment.
summary:
The discussion on the widespread presence of microplastics and their potential impact on human health is concerning, especially with the estimate of humans consuming thousands of microplastic particles yearly through food and water. The lack of clarity regarding the health impacts of ingesting microplastics raises valid concerns. Overall, the article points to the need for further research and awareness regarding this issue. 

Sentiment: 0.8
